summary: This is a letter motion from the U.S. Attorney's Office to the court in the case US v. Maxwell, requesting to preclude cross-examination and seeking to file the motion under seal. It appears to be part of the pre-trial legal proceedings.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.role: Recipient of email (likely court chambers staff)
persons.context: Appears as the recipient of an email from an Assistant United States Attorney regarding a motion filing in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Laura Mennin
persons.context: Copied on an email from an Assistant United States Attorney submitting a motion to preclude cross-examination in the Maxwell case.

events.title: Motion to Preclude Cross-Examination Filed
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office files a motion to preclude cross-examination in the case US v. Maxwell and requests it be filed under seal.

keyFacts: The document is a court filing in the case US v. Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN).
The U.S. Attorney's Office is seeking to preclude cross-examination of an unspecified nature.
The government requested the motion be filed under seal, indicating sensitive content.
The filing date was November 28, 2021, during the pre-trial phase of Ghislaine Maxwell's prosecution.
